text: Timothy Patrick Sheehy (born November 18, 1985)"Minnesota Birth Index, 1935-2002," database, FamilySearch (https://familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:VCZ6-931 : 4 December 2014), Timothy Patrick Sheehy, 18 Nov 1985; from "Minnesota Birth Index, 1935-2002," database, Ancestry (http://www.ancestry.com : 2004); citing Ramsey, Minnesota, United States, Minnesota Department of Health, Minneapolis. is an American former Navy SEAL, aerial firefighter, businessman and politician who is the junior United States Senator from Montana since 2025. He is a member of the Republican Party. He founded Bridger Aerospace. In 2023, Sheehy published a memoir, Mudslingers: A True Story of Aerial Firefighting. Sheehy was the Republican nominee for the U.S. Senate in 2024. He won the election in November 2024, beating Democratic incumbent Senator Jon Tester. ==References== Category:Living people Category:1985 births Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians Category:United States senators from Montana Category:Businesspeople from Montana Category:Businesspeople from Minnesota Category:Politicians from Minnesota
title: Tim Sheehy (American politician)
